title: Print, "Plan of Maison de Campagne", 1745
medium: Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper
inscribed:
On plate, upper center: 13me. Livre; upper center, in the image: Plan des Caves d'une Maison de Campagne, du dessein du Sr. Cuvilliés, premier Architecte de S.A.S.E. de Baviere…Corps de logis.; upper right: N; lower left: Inventé par F. de Cuvilliés; lower center: Se vend a Paris chez le Sr. Poilly ruë St. Iacque a limage St. Benoit Avec Privilege du Roy ét chez l'auteur.; lower right: Gravé par C.A. LEspillez/I

Various spaces are identified in captions. First state, before the addition of the privilege upper center: C.P.S.C.M.; see for the second state, cut out with the plate mark, I-81, acc. no.: 1931-94-575.
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 80 and 81)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Plan of Maison de Campagne", 1745.
1745. Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-285-67.
